name: core-animated-pages

events.name: core-animated-pages-transition-prepare
events.description:
Fired before a page transition occurs. Both pages involved in the transition are visible when
this event fires. This is useful if there is something the client needs to do when a page becomes
visible.

events.name: core-animated-pages-transition-end
events.description: Fired when a page transition completes.

attributes.name: transitions
attributes.description:
A space-delimited string of transitions to use when switching between pages in this element.
The strings are `id`s of `core-transition-pages` elements included elsewhere. See the
individual transition's document for specific details.

attributes.name: lastSelected
attributes.description:
The last page selected. This property is useful to dynamically set transitions based
on incoming and outgoing pages.

methods.name: selectPrevious
methods.description:
Selects the previous item. This should be used in single selection only.

                 wrap to the end

params.name: wrapped
params.description: if true and it is already at the first item,

methods.name: selectNext
methods.description:
Selects the next item.  This should be used in single selection only.

                 wrap to the front

params.name: wrapped
params.description: if true and it is already at the last item,

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description: User should call when resizing or un-hiding children

methods.name: resizeerShouldNotify
methods.description:
User should implement to introduce filtering when notifying children.
Generally, children that are hidden by the CoreResizer (e.g. non-active
pages) need not be notified during resize, since they will be notified
again when becoming un-hidden.

Return `true` if CoreResizable passed as argument should be notified of
resize.

attributes.name: selected
attributes.description:
Gets or sets the selected element. Default to use the index of the item element. If you want a specific attribute value of the element to be used instead of index, set "valueattr" to that attribute name. Example:
In multi-selection this should be an array of values. Example:
this.$.selector.selected = ['foo', 'zot'];

attributes.name: multi
attributes.description: If true, multiple selections are allowed.

attributes.name: valueattr
attributes.description: Specifies the attribute to be used for "selected" attribute.

attributes.name: selectedClass
attributes.description: Specifies the CSS class to be used to add to the selected element.

attributes.name: selectedProperty
attributes.description:
Specifies the property to be used to set on the selected element
to indicate its active state.

attributes.name: selectedAttribute
attributes.description:
Specifies the attribute to set on the selected element to indicate
its active state.

attributes.name: selectedItem
attributes.description:
Returns the currently selected element. In multi-selection this returns
an array of selected elements.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

attributes.name: selectedModel
attributes.description:
In single selection, this returns the model associated with the
selected element.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

attributes.name: selectedIndex
attributes.description:
In single selection, this returns the selected index.
Note that you should not use this to set the selection. Instead use
`selected`.

attributes.name: excludedLocalNames
attributes.description:
Nodes with local name that are in the list will not be included in the selection items. In the following example, `items` returns four `core-item`'s and doesn't include `h3` and `hr`.

Header

Item1 Item2
Item3 Item4

attributes.name: target
attributes.description:
The target element that contains items.  If this is not set
core-selector is the container.

attributes.name: itemsSelector
attributes.description:
This can be used to query nodes from the target node to be used for selection items. Note this only works if `target` is set and is not `core-selector` itself. Example:



color = {{color}}

attributes.name: activateEvent
attributes.description:
The event that would be fired from the item element to indicate
it is being selected.

attributes.name: notap
attributes.description:
Set this to true to disallow changing the selection via the
`activateEvent`.

events.name: core-select
events.description:
Fired when an item's selection state is changed. This event is fired both
when an item is selected or deselected. The `isSelected` detail property
contains the selection state.

params.name: detail.isSelected
params.description: true for selection and false for deselection

events.name: core-activate
events.description: Fired when an item element is tapped.

properties.name: items
properties.description: Returns an array of all items.

properties.name: resizerIsPeer
properties.description:
Set to `true` if the resizer is actually a peer to the elements it
resizes (e.g. splitter); in this case it will listen for resize requests
events from its peers on its parent.
